title: Brought up my vitamin D levels 30 points in 3 months!

I found these DailyD Vegan Vitamin D3 and took 2 pills a day (along with one vitamin k2) for three months and last time I had labs, my vitamin D level was 44! This is a great price, especially if you only need one a day, this bottle will last a full year!

title: ... D3 products that are tested by a third party like the NSF
body: One of the very few vitamin D3 products that are tested by a third party like the NSF. This guarantees that the product is pure and that you get the claimed dosage, very important for vitamin d intake. In addition, the soft gels do not contain any oil that may get rancid, like most other vitamin d supplements. Lastly, this is a branded vegan formula, as opposed to most other vitamin d supplements that come from animal source. It is best to go with branded formulas where research was performed versus generic, no-name ingredients which source and origin are unknown.

title: Pure formula and proper dosage
body: This product costs a lot more than the other D3 supplements I've found online.  However, you get what you pay for most of the time.  I love how this product is so pure/clean.  I always judge a product by not just the active ingredients but the inactive.  I shy away from magnesium stearate.  It's what that breaks down into that's not really good for you - stearic acid.  Meats contain enough of this and I don't need it added to my supplements.  So I do my best to reduce the intake of these compounds.

title: They do the trick!
body: I've experimented much with varying vitamin D dosages over the years. Currently there is a lot of good information out there that suggests that 5000 IU's is a good supplemental dosage of vitamin D, specially for people that don't get a lot of sun exposure on a daily basis. I have tried the 5000 IU dosage off and on again enough times to be able to determine that 5000 is a bit too high for my situation. Keep in mind that Vitamin D can have a hormonal effect when you get in to the higher dosages. In my case if I take 5000 IU's and stay on that dosage, after 1.5 to 2 months I start to have prostrate issues as in inflammation due to the fact that hormone levels increase (both testosterone and estrogen) at which point those hormones break down in to DHT or Dihydrotestosterone which is one of the main culprits of inflammation of the prostrate as androgenic alopecia (male pattern hair loss).

title: Works so well I had to cut back.

title: Transdermal / topical use works better than oral ingestion
body: works for transdermal topical application. It works better than oral ingestion, it increases blood levels steadily, without digestive hindrances, and with little absorption competition. I could tell mostly because my d levels are on the high side, and i tend to have hypercalcemia. Which by the way can be controlled with vitamin A retinol food intake. Since i take daily minimum of 2-3 k of vitamin d, i rubbed 2k of it into my forearms. Let me just say that it was too much. I developed a strong headache, though not the usual kidney discomfort i get. But after i control how much calcium i take, i feel well and very alert. One down side is that i noticed less bone mineralization i normally achieve, and my only explanation for this is that the transdermally taken vitamin d must have oxidized the majority of the vitamin A retinol from the bloodstream. Whenever i take vitamin A as retinol PLUS sufficient vitamin D together orally, i can feel the remineralization in my teeth. Normally during winter i feel miserable when taking vitamin A as retinol in any form, food or supplement. But after the transdermal application of vitamin d, i had no such ill feelings when taking vitamin A, which makes me wonder how much of it actually remained active. When exposed to the sun, the body makes just enough. But when i put it myself into my skin, it is not so precise - leaving error for too much or too little.

Fortunately, I don't get sick very often and when I do, it's normally a minor cold. So, are these helping boost my immunity? Heck if I know, but for their cost and purported benefit, why not take them? Folks with much more knowledge than I have regarding healthy choices generally recommend taking more than the RDA, which is now at 600 i.u.. The softgels are small and easy to swallow if those items are concerns to you.

title: Not independently certified to contain the advertised ingredients
body: Like every other Now Foods supplement I've ordered, it does not have a United States Pharmacopoeia (USP), NSF International (NSF), or ConsumerLab.com (CL) seal, so as a consumer I have no easy way to tell if it contains whether it contains the amount it claims to have, or whether it contains any harmful ingredients such as lead.  On average most supplements tested do contain the advertised ingredients in the expected doses, and do not contain harmful ingredients. However a significant fraction (more than 10%) of brands fail these tests, so I've learned to look for USP/NSF/CL certification to be as sure as I reasonably can be, short of sending the pills off to a lab myself.

I learned of it when we were dealing with my Mother's illness, and it was suggested that D3 be part of the regular regimen. Fortunately, I don't get sick very often and when I do, it's normally a minor cold. So, are these helping boost my immunity? Heck if I know, but for their cost and purported benefit, why not take them? Folks with much more knowledge than I have regarding healthy choices generally recommend taking more than the RDA, which is now at 600 i.u.. The softgels are small and easy to swallow if those items are concerns to you.

title: small and reasonably priced
body: As with all vitamins and minerals we take in pill form, we just trust that they contain what they purport and nothing else.  Aside from that, these Vitamin D pills are small (easy to swallow) and were reasonably priced. I don't think I saw any unnecessary or dangerous additives in the ingredient list either, for example dyes.

title: great for cloudy climates
body: I swear by Vitamin D for me and my kids. We are so rarely sick and I think it is because of the D. We live in Pittsburgh, so all winter we take one or two of these a day. I have one son who when he doesn't take it for a few days I can see it on his face, I mean literally he gets bags under his eyes and acts kind of melancholy, I give him 2 of these and turns him right around. I know that sounds kind of crazy, but I swear it's true!

NEVER has a vitamin had such a big impact on my mood. My mood is SIGNIFICANTLY elevated. It has actually changed my life as corny as that sounds. I'm getting a lot more done because I have more energy and people seem to like being around me more now that I'm not so mopey haha! This was the missing piece in my nutrition.

This pill is tiny and super easy to take.

title: My personal experience with this Vitamin D-3
body: This may not apply to everyone!  I am sensitive to many supplements--for some reason, I did not feel good after taking this.  I had it tested with a holistic Doctor and he agreed it is not good for ME.  I was tested on other D-3 supplements and I did not test well for them either .  I am not sure why yet I may need the vitamin K with the D.  I used to take that by Thorn and did very well.  The best thing in general is to get about 30 minutes of direct sun a day on your skin, if you are not too sensitive to the sun.  Other than eating small bony fish, there are not too many ways to get enough Vitamin D especially living up north where there is limited amounts of sunlight, particularly in the winter.  I am a vegan, and not surprised that my vitamin D levels are low. When the vitamin D levels are so low, it effects my LDL (low density cholesterol) and raises it.  I have a great diet, yet need my sunlight to absorb enough Vitamin D to regulate my system.  I am sure this may be a good product sinceI like many NOW brand items.  I believe it is just the type of vitamin D, and I should take it with K .

title: No side effects - Very effective
body: The only Vitamin D I can take with NO side effects (jittery, headaches, palpitations).  My Vit D level was 26. My doctor put me on a prescribed high dose (50,000 IU) once a week for three months. Level went up to 46 and I felt great (well being, mood improvement, join pains disappear). However, after I stopped taking the high dose, my doctor recommended 2,000 IU per day. I bought 4 different brands in health food store, best quality I could find/perceive, but started having jittery results, palpitations, etc.  It turns out that after having been on high dose for three months, then my levels plummeted and started major symptoms (withdrawals?) with feelings of depression, bone pain, and, the worse symptom, unable to sleep due to major palpitations.  After ER visits, cardiac monitors (all in a great effort to address the symptoms and not the root cause), a different doctor suggested Vit D 5000 IU by Thorne daily.  After three days of taking them, I started to feel like I had not felt for years.  No side effects, in fact, these pills provided a very calming effect vs the jittery effects from the other ones.  Regarding cost:  Thorne is priced similarly to health food store brands, and they work.  Also, if you are a woman in the early 50s, and you are not feeling yourself, have your Vitamin D levels checked. If low, take these vs all the other major drugs some doctors are so quick to prescribe.  You'll feel a million times better without taking drugs that eventually will provide other/new side effects.  Great product, highly recommend it.  Shipping was excellent.  I got it next day.

title: Kirkland bulk pills for the win!
body: Did you know that most people are vitamin D deficient? I never would have thought to test for it, but when both my sisters came up low, I went and got tested and sure enough I was VERY low myself. My doctor instructed to take 2000-3000 IU a day so the Kirkland brand plus a multivitamin puts me right where I need to be. I have no idea why this isn't sold my in my costco store, but its really nice to have it available on amazon at a fair price. Everything available in stores is too small of an IU per capsule and/or bottle amount. With this, I am able to buy and be good for the year! There really is something to taking this supplement, as I try to routinely get tested and I am now in the normal range. I should mention that I live in the traditionally sunny San Diego, so my deficiency isn't due to lack of sun exposure. I guess my body just can't produce enough naturally. I recommend everyone get their vitamin D level tested when doing other blood tests - you might find out you are low too and never knew! It's not a standard testing and you will most likely have to be the one to initiate it.

title: Must buy!
body: Doctor recommended that I take a D3 supplement as I was incredibly deficient....Most people are deficient and do not know it. Ask you doc to check on your next blood tests! Anyhow, I found this, and it is the absolute best deal you will find for the size and price. I feel like a broken record because I bought several Kirkland vitamins, and all my reviews state that these were the best price, and quantity, and the quality has been fantastic. I will buy these over and over again, but it won't be that often because these will last me well over a year.

title: Great value for D3
body: You get a lot of capsules for your money.  D3 is the form of vit D we should all be taking everyday.  As a dietitian, I recommend all my patients take 1000 to 2000 IU each day.  Not only does it help our bodies absorb calcium, but it is good for our colons, mental health, immunity, and more.  This vitamin (which acts as a hormone) is very important and many Americans are missing the mark as far as getting enough.  Even the RDA underestimates the dose we need.  Some experts push 5000 to 10000 IU DAILY!

title: Foul smelling upon opening; unable to return due to seller return policy
body: These smelled remarkably foul upon my opening them.  There did not appear to be any ruptured softgels.  But the smell was awful.  I have had numerous brands of D3 before and have never had any with a foul odor upon opening the package.  Will Not be using these.

title: Order these during the cooler months.......... to avoid clumping
body: I ordered this product in the winter months........the reason.......... summers gets hot and sticky and these gel capsules may become soft and stick together while being transported in trailers and trucks........arriving in one huge clump. Now you could put them in the freezer for an hour or two, shake the heck out of the container to try and separate them..........but it's just as easy to order them during the cooler months than go through that hassle.  I trust Kirkland products and these are no exception.

title: Vitamin D3
body: I was feeling tired and just run-down. Went to the doctor and had blood work, to find out that I was low to deficient in Vit D. After some research on vitamins, Kirkland brand comes out on top for quality. I don't live any where near a Cosco- so purchased here because price was good. Even being low in Vit. D, I take only one pill (2000I.U.) a day. More than 6000 I.U. is actually harmful, I guess. All in all, I would say that the pills are actually working - I have regained my zip, which makes me think that I could honestly recommend these vitamins.

title: Vitamin D3
body: Doctor's having a fit about my Vitamin D deficiency.  (Hey, it was winter, and it was cold, and I don't like snow.  There's no sunshine indoors and precious little outdoors in the winter anyway.)  I took these, one a day, and my Vitamin D levels were back to normal in 3 months.  Easy to swallow small gelcaps, good price, fast delivery.  Nothing more to say, right?

title: Another awesome Costco/Kirkland product.
body: Excellent quality and excellent results.  Every six months I must go for blood testing since I do have to take a statin drug.  This is the way they monitor liver enzymes.  My vitamin D level was outstanding and my doctor advised me to continue what I am doing to maintain this level.  Thanks for reading.

body: 2000 iu might be a tad high for me, my Dr recommended 1000. So I just take one every other day to balance it out. Too much vitamin d isn't good, you have to find the right amount for you, and get your level tested at least once a year.

body: I notice a difference for the better when I take these.  That is all that matters right? I like the high dosage too so you can take fewer of them. Why fiddle around with low doses?

title: Too short a time before expiration to use all product as recommended

title: Amazon Needs To List All Ingredients

I wouldn't buy another supplement from Amazon again unless I knew of its content from another source and could not find it apart from Amazon.  Highly disappointed.

It protects against adult and elderly muscle weakness and immune system issues, and lowers the risk of colon, breast, and prostate cancers. Rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis is improved with vitamin D3.  Vitamin D3 prevents/treats rickets, post menopausal osteoporosis. The vitamin also treats hypoglycemia, Multiple Sclerosis and the development of Type 1 diabetes.  I am rarely in the sun, so this has been a necessary supplement for me.

title: Good for the Winter

title: Love this brand of Vitamin D3
body: Love this brand of Vitamin D3.  Very important to take, to prevent cancer and flu, colds, all diseases.  Must be taken with K2, to put it where it is needed.  I have been taking this product for several years now, after having cancer, and now that I get my D3 levels checked every year, and found out that D3 needs to be in the 80 to 100 range....(not the 40 range that I was in, when I had cancer, but thought the amount of D3 I was taking, was enough).....I am now taking 5 of these D3 per day along with 1 of K2, per my doctor, just as a "Maintenance" amount, and my cancer has not returned.  Never had chemo or radiation....I refused, as these "cause" cancer.  Be your own advocate, and take your D3 & K2......  I LOVE this product, and will continue to order from this Seller.

I had a blood test that showed that I was low on Vitamin D which really surprised me because I walk almost every day in the sun for at least an hour.  My doc suggested that I take a D-3 supplement.  I'm still walking in the sun most days (because it's summer...we'll see what happens in the winter) and taking my D-3.  I don't really feel any different, but when I take my next blood test, we'll see if the supplement helps....thus the 4 star rating instead of 5.  Due to Source Natural's adherence to maintaining a high level of product integrity and the research I put into making my decision to by their D-3, I would have normally given them a 5 star.

title: Contains Wheat!
body: PLEASE READ THE LABEL CAREFULLY, WHAT YOU GET IS NOT WHAT IS ADVERTISED!  The image on here specifically says no wheat, however, the product we received was almost identical except for the fact that the ingredients contain wheat.  My wife is very allergic to wheat and if not for her careful reading of the label out of habit she could have easily taken one and gone into anaphylaxis.  She dodged a bullet.  We won't be buying supplements from Amazon again.  Really disappointed.

I am afraid to ingest them as I have no idea what actually is in the bottles.
